data.text:
Buona Vista MRT Station is a bustling transportation hub located in Queenstown, Singapore. As an interchange station for both the East West line and Circle line, it provides easy access to many parts of Singapore. Whether you’re a local resident or a tourist visiting Singapore, Buona Vista MRT Station is an excellent starting point for exploring the city.

The station layout is designed to provide maximum convenience and accessibility to commuters. With multiple exits and entrances, you can easily reach your destination without getting lost. The station is also equipped with elevators, escalators, and other accessibility features for people with disabilities or mobility issues.

Key Takeaways

Buona Vista MRT Station is a convenient transportation hub located in Queenstown, Singapore.

The station layout is designed for maximum convenience and accessibility.

Buona Vista MRT Station provides easy access to many parts of Singapore.

Station Layout

You are at Buona Vista MRT Station, an interchange station along the East-West Line (EWL) and Circle Line (CCL) in Singapore. The station has an underground section for the EWL and an elevated section for the CCL.

Platforms

Buona Vista MRT Station has two island platforms, one for the EWL and one for the CCL. The EWL platform is located underground and serves trains heading towards Pasir Ris and Tuas Link. The CCL platform is located above ground and serves trains heading towards HarbourFront and Marina Bay.

Exits

Buona Vista MRT Station has four exits: A, B, C, and D. Exit A leads to Anglo-Chinese Junior College, while Exit B leads to the Ministry of Education Language Centre. Exit C leads to the Civil Service College, while Exit D leads to the Buona Vista Bus Terminal.

Facilities

Buona Vista MRT Station has a range of facilities to make your journey comfortable and convenient. The station has lifts, escalators, and stairs to help you move between levels. There are also fare gates, ticketing machines, and top-up machines for your convenience.

In addition, Buona Vista MRT Station has a range of retail and dining options, including a 7-Eleven, a McDonald’s, and a Starbucks. There are also public toilets, a nursing room, and a bicycle parking area for your convenience.

That’s all you need to know about Buona Vista MRT Station’s layout. Enjoy your journey!

Connectivity and Accessibility

If you’re looking for a well-connected MRT station in Singapore, Buona Vista MRT station is an excellent choice. This station is a Mass Rapid Transit (MRT) interchange station on the East West line and Circle line in Queenstown, Singapore, making it easy to get around the city. Here’s a breakdown of the various transportation options available at Buona Vista MRT station.

Bus Interchange

Buona Vista MRT station is well-connected to the bus network in Singapore. There is a bus interchange located across Commonwealth Ave, making it easy to catch a bus to other parts of the city. The bus interchange is also wheelchair accessible, so it’s a great option for those with mobility issues.

Taxi Stands

If you prefer to take a taxi, there are several taxi stands located near the station. These taxi stands are conveniently located, making it easy to catch a taxi to your destination. Additionally, the taxi stands are well-lit and monitored by security cameras, so you can feel safe and secure while waiting for your ride.

Buona Vista MRT station is also well-connected to the pedestrian network in Singapore. There are several pedestrian links that connect the station to nearby buildings and amenities. For example, there is an overhead bridge across North Buona Vista Road that leads to the Biopolis, a high technology business park for the biomedical science, infocomm technology and media industries. This bridge does not provide disabled access, but there are other pedestrian links that do.

Overall, Buona Vista MRT station is a great choice for those looking for a well-connected and accessible MRT station in Singapore. With its easy access to the bus network, taxi stands, and pedestrian links, you’ll be able to get around the city with ease.

Surrounding Amenities

If you are looking for a place with a great balance of convenience and lifestyle, look no further than Buona Vista MRT Station. This station is surrounded by a plethora of amenities that cater to your every need. Whether you want to go shopping, enjoy a delicious meal, or explore nature, Buona Vista MRT Station has it all.

Shopping and Dining

Rochester Mall is located just a stone’s throw away from Buona Vista MRT Station, and it offers a wide array of shopping and dining options. You can find everything from high-end fashion to everyday essentials, and there are plenty of cafes and restaurants where you can grab a bite to eat. In addition to Rochester Mall, you can also explore the nearby Ghim Moh Estate for local hawker food.

Education and Institutions

Buona Vista MRT Station is located near several prestigious educational institutions, including the National University of Singapore and One-North. These institutions offer a wide range of educational opportunities, from undergraduate degrees to postgraduate research. If you are looking to further your education or pursue a career in academia, Buona Vista MRT Station is the perfect place to start.

Parks and Recreation

For those who love the great outdoors, Buona Vista MRT Station is located near several parks and recreational areas. Kent Ridge Park is just a short distance away and offers a variety of hiking trails and scenic views. You can also explore the nearby Singapore Science Park, which is home to several research institutes and technology companies.

Overall, Buona Vista MRT Station is the perfect place to live, work, and play. With its convenient location and wide range of amenities, you will never run out of things to do or places to explore. So why wait? Start planning your next adventure today!

Art and Culture

If you are an art enthusiast, you will be delighted to know that Buona Vista MRT Station is home to several stunning art pieces. Here are some of the artworks you can find at the station:

Art in Transit Program

Buona Vista MRT Station is part of the Art in Transit program, which is Singapore’s largest public art showcase. The program commissions local artists to create original artworks for MRT stations, providing an opportunity for the artists to celebrate Singapore’s local history and community. The Tree of Life, a sculpture by Gilles Massot, is one of the most popular pieces of art in the station. The sculpture is made of stainless steel and stands at an impressive 6 meters tall. It features intricate designs of leaves and branches, and its placement at the station’s entrance makes it hard to miss.

Station Artworks

Apart from The Tree of Life, Buona Vista MRT Station also features several other station artworks that are worth checking out. These artworks include a series of murals that depict the history of the area and its transformation into a modern business hub. The murals are located at the station’s concourse level and feature bold colors and striking designs.

In addition to the murals, the station also features a series of glass panels that depict the flora and fauna of the area. The panels are located on the station’s platform level and provide a refreshing and calming ambiance for commuters waiting for their trains.

Overall, Buona Vista MRT Station is a great place to experience Singapore’s vibrant art and culture scene. Whether you’re a local or a tourist, make sure to take some time to explore the station’s art pieces and appreciate the creativity and talent of Singapore’s local artists.

Technical Specifications

Station Code and Map

Buona Vista MRT Station is located in Queenstown, Singapore. The station code for Buona Vista MRT Station is EW21/CC22, where EW stands for East-West Line and CC stands for Circle Line. The station is situated near the junction of North Buona Vista Road and Commonwealth Road West. You can find the station location on the official SMRT map under the East-West Line and Circle Line sections.

Train Services

Buona Vista MRT Station is an interchange station between the East-West Line and Circle Line. The East-West Line runs from Pasir Ris to Tuas Link, while the Circle Line runs from HarbourFront to Marina Bay. The station has two levels – the upper level serves the East-West Line, while the lower level serves the Circle Line. Buona Vista MRT Station is the second elevated-underground interchange station built, after Paya Lebar station.

The station has a total of four platforms, with two platforms serving the East-West Line and two platforms serving the Circle Line. The station is fitted with high-volume low-speed fans, which commenced operations on 25 June 2012, the same day as the fans at Commonwealth.

Buona Vista MRT Station is operated by SMRT Trains, which is a subsidiary of SMRT Corporation. SMRT Trains operates the North-South Line, East-West Line, Circle Line, and Bukit Panjang LRT Line. SMRT Corporation is the leading multi-modal public transport operator in Singapore, providing integrated transport services across the island.

Visitor Information

Are you planning to visit Buona Vista MRT Station in Singapore? Here’s everything you need to know to make your trip as smooth as possible.

Operating Hours

Buona Vista MRT Station is open daily from 5:30 AM to 12:00 AM. You can catch the first train at 5:34 AM and the last train at 11:50 PM. Please note that train timings may vary on weekends and public holidays.

Directions and Maps

Buona Vista MRT Station is located at the junction of Commonwealth Avenue West and North Buona Vista Road in Queenstown, Singapore. The station is an interchange station for both the East West Line and Circle Line, making it easy to get around the city.

To get to the station, you can take the MRT, bus, or taxi. If you’re taking the MRT, simply follow the signs to the East West Line or Circle Line platforms. If you’re taking the bus, there are several bus stops near the station, including the one at Buona Vista Station Exit D.

If you’re driving, there are several parking options available near the station. The Buona Vista MRT Station car park is open 24 hours a day, and there are several public car parks nearby.

Frequently Asked Questions

What are the operating hours for the local MRT station?

Buona Vista MRT Station operates from 5:30 am to 12:00 am daily. The operating hours may vary on public holidays and special occasions.

Can I find a map of the station layout online?

Yes, you can find a map of the Buona Vista MRT Station layout online. You can check the official website of the Land Transport Authority of Singapore or visit this link to download the station information kit provided by SMRT Corporation.

Which MRT line can I catch at this station?

Buona Vista MRT Station is an interchange station for the East-West Line (EWL) and Circle Line (CCL). You can catch either of these lines at this station.

How do I get to Star Vista from the nearby MRT?

Star Vista is a shopping mall located close to Buona Vista MRT Station, and you can get there by taking Exit D from the station. Once you exit the station, follow the signs leading to Star Vista.

Which station exit should I use for the best access to nearby amenities?

The station has four exits, and the best exit to use depends on your destination. If you are heading towards the Ministry of Education, National University Hospital, or the National University of Singapore, you should use Exit C. If you’re heading towards Buona Vista Bus Interchange or the Star Vista shopping mall, you should use Exit D.

What’s the schedule for the last train departing at night?

The last train departing from Buona Vista MRT Station varies depending on the day of the week and the direction of travel. You can check the official website of the SMRT Corporation for the latest train schedules.
